content.query:
-- Create and load DimDateTime table
-- A dimension table that breaks down date and time components.
-- Contains detailed temporal information such as year, month, day, hour, minute, 
--and whether the date is a weekend.

CREATE TABLE DimDateTime (
    date_time DATETIME,
    date DATE,
    year INT,
    month INT,
    day INT,
    hour INT,
    minute INT,
    second INT,
    quarter INT,
    week INT,
    day_of_week INT,
    day_name VARCHAR(10),
    month_name VARCHAR(10),
    is_weekend BIT
);
GO

INSERT INTO DimDateTime (started_at, date, year, month, day, 
hour, minute, second, quarter, week, 
day_of_week, day_name, month_name, is_weekend)
SELECT DISTINCT
    started_at,
    CAST(started_at AS DATE) AS date,
    DATEPART(YEAR, started_at) AS year,
    DATEPART(MONTH, started_at) AS month,
    DATEPART(DAY, started_at) AS day,
    DATEPART(HOUR, started_at) AS hour,
    DATEPART(MINUTE, started_at) AS minute,
    DATEPART(SECOND, started_at) AS second,
    DATEPART(QUARTER, started_at) AS quarter,
    DATEPART(WEEK, started_at) AS week,
    DATEPART(WEEKDAY, started_at) AS day_of_week,
    DATENAME(WEEKDAY, started_at) AS day_name,
    DATENAME(MONTH, started_at) AS month_name,
    CASE WHEN DATEPART(WEEKDAY, started_at) IN (1, 7) THEN 1 ELSE 0 END AS is_weekend
FROM
    ExternalBluebike;
GO
